history.proof: intros X P H_finite H_dec. shelve.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), FiniteT X -> (forall x : X, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> {forall x : X, P x} + {exists x : X, ~ P x}

Premises:
Inductive FiniteT : Type -> Prop := empty_finite : FiniteT False | add_finite : forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> FiniteT (option T) | bij_finite : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> invertible f -> FiniteT Y Arguments FiniteT _%type_scope Arguments add_finite _%type_scope Arguments bij_finite (_ _)%type_scope _%function_scope
finite_dec_exists : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), FiniteT X -> (forall x : X, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> {exists x : X, P x} + {forall x : X, ~ P x}
List.Forall_dec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall l : list A, {List.Forall P l} + {~ List.Forall P l}
List.Forall_Exists_dec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall l : list A, {List.Forall P l} + {List.Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l}
List.Exists_dec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> {List.Exists P l} + {~ List.Exists P l}
List.neg_Forall_Exists_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> ~ List.Forall P l -> List.Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l
FiniteT_sind : forall P : Type -> SProp, P False -> (forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> P T -> P (option T)) -> (forall (X Y : Type) (f1 : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> P X -> invertible f1 -> P Y) -> forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> P T
FiniteT_ind : forall P : Type -> Prop, P False -> (forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> P T -> P (option T)) -> (forall (X Y : Type) (f1 : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> P X -> invertible f1 -> P Y) -> forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> P T
Inductive invertible (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) : Prop := intro_invertible : forall g : Y -> X, (forall x : X, g (f x) = x) -> (forall y : Y, f (g y) = y) -> invertible f Arguments invertible {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments intro_invertible {X Y}%type_scope (_ _ _ _)%function_scope
constructive_definite_description : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), (exists ! x : A, P x) -> {x : A | P x}
bij_finite : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> invertible f -> FiniteT Y
ChoiceFacts.ConstructiveDefiniteDescription_on = fun A : Type => forall P : A -> Prop, (exists ! x : A, P x) -> {x : A | P x} : Type -> Type Arguments ChoiceFacts.ConstructiveDefiniteDescription_on _%type_scope
Inductive FiniteT : Type -> Prop := empty_finite : FiniteT False | add_finite : forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> FiniteT (option T) | bij_finite : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> invertible f -> FiniteT Y Arguments FiniteT _%type_scope Arguments add_finite _%type_scope Arguments bij_finite (_ _)%type_scope _%function_scope
Eqdep_dec.K_dec_set : forall A : Set, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (x : A) (P : x = x -> Prop), P eq_refl -> forall p : x = x, P p
Eqdep_dec.K_dec_type : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (x : A) (P : x = x -> Prop), P eq_refl -> forall p : x = x, P p
List.Exists_Forall_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, P x \/ ~ P x) -> List.Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l < -> ~ List.Forall P l
ChoiceFacts.constructive_definite_descr_excluded_middle : (forall A : Type, ChoiceFacts.ConstructiveDefiniteDescription_on A) -> (forall P : Prop, P \/ ~ P) -> forall P : Prop, {P} + {~ P}
ChoiceFacts.fun_reification_descr_computational_excluded_middle_in_prop_context : (forall A B : Type, ChoiceFacts.FunctionalRelReification_on A B) -> (forall P : Prop, P \/ ~ P) -> forall C : Prop, ((forall P : Prop, {P} + {~ P}) -> C) -> C
Eqdep_dec.K_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, x = y \/ x <> y) -> forall (x : A) (P : x = x -> Prop), P eq_refl -> forall p : x = x, P p
Bool.reflect_ind : forall (P : Prop) (P0 : forall b : bool, Bool.reflect P b -> Prop), (forall p : P, P0 true (Bool.ReflectT P p)) -> (forall n : ~ P, P0 false (Bool.ReflectF P n)) -> forall (b : bool) (r : Bool.reflect P b), P0 b r
Eqdep_dec.inj_pair2_eq_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (P : A -> Type) (p : A) (x y : P p), existT P p x = existT P p y -> x = y
decidable_dec : forall P : Prop, P \/ ~ P -> {P} + {~ P}
Wf_Z.natlike_rec : forall P : BinNums.Z -> Set, P BinNums.Z0 -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 x -> P x -> P (BinInt.Z.succ x)) -> forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 x -> P x
Eqdep_dec.eq_dep_eq_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (P : A -> Type) (p : A) (x y : P p), eq_dep A P p x p y -> x = y
List.Forall_forall : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), List.Forall P l < -> (forall x : A, List.In x l -> P x)
exclusive_dec : forall P Q : Prop, ~ (P /\ Q) -> P \/ Q -> {P} + {Q}
List.Forall_cons : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> List.Forall P l -> List.Forall P (x :: l)
Bool.reflect_dec : forall (P : Prop) (b : bool), Bool.reflect P b -> {P} + {~ P}
List.Forall_nil : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), List.Forall P nil
BinNums.positive_rec : forall P : BinNums.positive -> Set, (forall p : BinNums.positive, P p -> P (BinNums.xI p)) -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, P p -> P (BinNums.xO p)) -> P BinNums.xH -> forall p : BinNums.positive, P p
List.Exists_cons_hd : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> List.Exists P (x :: l)
BinNums.Z_rec : forall P : BinNums.Z -> Set, P BinNums.Z0 -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, P (BinNums.Zpos p)) -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, P (BinNums.Zneg p)) -> forall z : BinNums.Z, P z
String.string_rec : forall P : String.string -> Set, P String.EmptyString -> (forall (a : Ascii.ascii) (s : String.string), P s -> P (String.String a s)) -> forall s : String.string, P s
BinNums.N_rec : forall P : BinNums.N -> Set, P BinNums.N0 -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, P (BinNums.Npos p)) -> forall n : BinNums.N, P n
Inductive eq_dep (U : Type) (P : U -> Type) (p : U) (x : P p) : forall q : U, P q -> Prop := eq_dep_intro : eq_dep U P p x p x Arguments eq_dep _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments eq_dep_intro _%type_scope _%function_scope
List.Exists_exists : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), List.Exists P l < -> (exists x : A, List.In x l /\ P x)
List.Exists_cons_tl : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), List.Exists P l -> List.Exists P (x :: l)
Inductive reflect (P : Prop) : bool -> Set := ReflectT : P -> Bool.reflect P true | ReflectF : ~ P -> Bool.reflect P false Arguments Bool.reflect _%type_scope _%bool_scope Arguments Bool.ReflectT _%type_scope Arguments Bool.ReflectF _%type_scope
Bool.ReflectF : forall P : Prop, ~ P -> Bool.reflect P false
Inductive Forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := Forall_nil : List.Forall P nil | Forall_cons : forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> List.Forall P l -> List.Forall P (x :: l) Arguments List.Forall [A]%type_scope _%function_scope _%list_scope Arguments List.Forall_nil [A]%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments List.Forall_cons [A]%type_scope [P]%function_scope _ [l]%list_scope
Inductive Exists (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := Exists_cons_hd : forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> List.Exists P (x :: l) | Exists_cons_tl : forall (x : A) (l : list A), List.Exists P l -> List.Exists P (x :: l) Arguments List.Exists [A]%type_scope _%function_scope _%list_scope Arguments List.Exists_cons_hd [A]%type_scope _%function_scope _ _%list_scope Arguments List.Exists_cons_tl [A]%type_scope [P]%function_scope _ [l]%list_scope

``` 
intros X P H_finite H_dec.
induction H_finite; intros.
- left. intros. apply (H_dec x).
- destruct (IHH_finite H_dec) as [HP | HnotP].
  + left. intros. destruct (H_dec x) as [HPx | HnotPx]; auto.
  + destruct (H_dec None) as [HNone | HnotNone].
    * left. intros. destruct (H_dec x) as [HPx | HnotPx]; auto. 
    * right. destruct HnotP as [x HnotPx].
      exists x. intros Hx. apply HnotPx. destruct Hx; auto.
- destruct (finite_dec_exists T P H_finite H_dec) as [Hexists | Hnotforall].
  destruct Hexists as [x HPx]. left. intros x0.
  destruct (Eqdep_dec.K_dec Set decidable_dec x x0) as [Hxx0 | Hnotxx0].
  + rewrite Hxx0. exact HPx.
  + right. intros Hfalse. apply Hnotxx0. apply Hfalse. exact HPx.
```

original: intros X P H_finite H_dec. induction H_finite; intros. - left. intros. apply (H_dec x). - destruct (IHH_finite H_dec) as [HP | HnotP]. + left. intros. destruct (H_dec x) as [HPx | HnotPx]; auto. + destruct (H_dec None) as [HNone | HnotNone]. * left. intros. destruct (H_dec x) as [HPx | HnotPx]; auto. * right. destruct HnotP as [x HnotPx]. exists x. intros Hx. apply HnotPx. destruct Hx; auto. - destruct (finite_dec_exists T P H_finite H_dec) as [Hexists | Hnotforall]. destruct Hexists as [x HPx]. left. intros x0. destruct (Eqdep_dec.K_dec Set decidable_dec x x0) as [Hxx0 | Hnotxx0]. + rewrite Hxx0. apply HPx. + right. intros Hfalse. apply Hnotxx0. apply Hfalse. apply HPx.
